title: DoubtfulQA Component Props
description: Schema for the DoubtfulQA component that displays common confusion points as questions with clear answers

questions.description: List of 5-8 confusion points per lesson section, phrased as questions with answers

question.description: Question as a student would phrase it (e.g., 'Why can't robot parts just talk directly?')

answer.description: Clear, simple answer with analogy if helpful

category.description: Type of confusion this question addresses

misconception_addressed.description: What wrong belief or misunderstanding does this question reveal?

follow_up_questions.description: Optional list of related follow-up questions for deeper exploration

visual_aid.description: Optional path to diagram or image that helps explain the answer

allowExpand.description: Whether to make questions collapsible (accordion style)

showCategory.description: Whether to display the confusion category label

questions.question: Why can't robot parts just talk directly to each other instead of using middleware?
questions.answer: Great question! Imagine if every student in your school had to remember the phone number of every other student to share homework. That would be really hard! Middleware is like having a class announcement system - you just say your message once, and everyone who wants to hear it can listen. It's much easier than calling everyone separately!

questions.question: Is ROS2 an operating system like Windows?
questions.answer: Nope! Even though it's called 'Robot Operating System,' ROS2 is actually more like a set of tools that runs ON TOP of an operating system (like Windows or Linux). Think of it this way: If Linux is like the foundation and walls of a house, ROS2 is like the furniture and appliances inside that make the house useful. You need both!
